movie_title: 50% adults overweight or obese by 2050: Global study: BBC Learning English from the News
introduction: What does this new study reveal about obesity? üîéFor a free worksheet, and all the vocabulary and de

vocabulary.definition: a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time
vocabulary.example: The flu epidemic caused many people to get sick last winter.

vocabulary.definition: very great or intense; having or showing great knowledge or insight
vocabulary.example: The professor made a profound impact on his students with his lectures.

vocabulary.definition: occurring or done before the usual or proper time; too early
vocabulary.example: The premature baby needed special care in the neonatal unit.

vocabulary.definition: being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else
vocabulary.example: Her painting style is truly unique and stands out among other artists.

vocabulary.definition: indicates the faults or merits of someone or something in a disapproving way
vocabulary.example: The movie critic harshly criticises the film for its poor plot and acting.

vocabulary.definition: make (something) visible, typically by uncovering it; reveal
vocabulary.example: The investigative journalist exposes corruption within the government.
